titleInfo.title: USA v. Sahal et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER on the oral motion of defendant Dahir Sahal for an extension of the pretiral motion deadline. Sahals motion for an extension of time to file pretrial motions is granted. Sahal and Mohamed shall have to on or before July 15, 2011, in which to file pretrial motions in accordance with the progression order as to defendant Dahir Sahal, Abdirahman Farah Mohamed. The ends of justice have been served by granting such motion and outweigh the interests of the public and the defendants in a speedy trial. The additional time arising as a result of the granting of the motion, i.e., the time from the governments deadline for discovery and the pretrial motion deadline, i.e., from June 3, 2011, through July 15, 2011, shall be deemed excludable time in any computation of time under the requirement of the Speedy Trial Act. Ordered by Magistrate Judge Thomas D. Thalken. (MKR)ORDER on the oral motion of defendant Dahir Sahal for an extension of the pretiral motion deadline. Sahals motion for an extension of time to file pretrial motions is granted. Sahal and Mohamed shall have to on or before July 15, 2011, in which to file pretrial motions in accordance with the progression order as to defendant Dahir Sahal, Abdirahman Farah Mohamed. The ends of justice have been served by granting such motion and outweigh the interests of the public and the defendants in a speedy trial. The additional time arising as a result of the granting of the motion, i.e., the time from the governments deadline for discovery and the pretrial motion deadline, i.e., from June 3, 2011, through July 15, 2011, shall be deemed excludable time in any computation of time under the requirement of the Speedy Trial Act. Ordered by Magistrate Judge Thomas D. Thalken. (MKR)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Sahal et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER as to Dahir Sahal (1). IT IS ORDERED: Each of the defendants' motions for an extension of time to file pretrial motions, Filing No. 15 in 8:11CR170, Filing No. 15 in 8:11CR171, and Filing No. 20 in 8:11CR172, is denied as moot. Each of the defendants' oral motions for an extension of time to file pretrial motions is granted, and they shall have to on or before July 22, 2011, in which to file pretrial motions in accordance with the progression order. The ends of justice have been served by granting such motions and outweigh the interests of the public and the defendants in a speedy trial. The additional time arising as a result of the granting of the motion, from June 13, 2011 through July 22, 2011, shall be deemed excludable time in any computation of time under the requirement of the Speedy Trial Act for the reason defendants' counsel require additional time to adequately prepare the case, taking into consideration due diligence of counsel, and the novelty and complexity of this case. The failure to grant additional time might result in a miscarriage of justice. 18 U.S.C. § 3161(h)(7)(A)&(B). Pretrial Motion Deadline set for 7/22/2011. Ordered by Magistrate Judge Thomas D. Thalken. (TEL)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 8:11-cr-00172; USA v. Sahal et al;

The failure to grant additional time might result in a miscarriage of justice. 18 U.S.C. § 3161(h)(7)(A)&(B). Pretrial Motion Deadline set for 7/22/2011. Ordered by Magistrate Judge Thomas D. Thalken. (TEL)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Sahal et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER as to defendants Dahir Sahal and Abdirahman Farah Mohamed. The oral motion for an extension of time to file pretrial motions is granted. All defendants named above shall have to on or before September 28, 2011, in which to file pretrial motions in accordance with the progression orders. (Pretrial Motion Deadline set for 9/28/2011) The additional time arising as a result of the granting of the motion, i.e., the time between July 20, 2011, and September 28, 2011, shall be deemed excludable time in any computation of time under the requirement of the Speedy Trial Act. (Excludable started 7/20/2011, Excludable stopped 9/28/2011) Ordered by Magistrate Judge Thomas D. Thalken. (TEL)ORDER as to defendants Dahir Sahal and Abdirahman Farah Mohamed. titleInfo.title: USA v. Sahal et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER granting 28 Motion to Continue as to Dahir Sahal (1), Abdirahman Farah Mohamed (2). Both defendants are given until on or before November 14, 2011, in which to file pretrial motions pursuant to the progression order. The time between September 14, 2011, and November 14, 2011, shall be deemed excludable time in any computation of time under the requirement of the Speedy Trial Act. Ordered by Magistrate Judge Thomas D. Thalken. (ADB)ORDER granting 28 Motion to Continue as to Dahir Sahal (1), Abdirahman Farah Mohamed (2). titleInfo.title: USA v. Sahal et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER granting 34 Motion to Continue as to Abdirahman Farah Mohamed. Trial is re-scheduled for 1/23/2012 at 08:30 AM in Courtroom 3, Roman L. Hruska Federal Courthouse, 111 South 18th Plaza, Omaha, NE before Judge Joseph F. Bataillon and a jury. The additional time between January 10, 2012 and January 23, 2012 shall be deemed excludable time in any computation of time under the requirement of the Speedy Trial Act. Mohamed's request to waive juiry trial will be considered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon at a hearing on 1/17/2012 at 01:00 PM in Courtroom 3, Roman L. Hruska Federal Courthouse, 111 South 18th Plaza, Omaha, NE. Ordered by Magistrate Judge Thomas D. Thalken. (KMG)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Sahal et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER granting 40 Motion for Hearing and to disqualify a translator as a witness as to Abdirahman Farah Mohamed. The government shall disclose the true name of the translator to defense counsel Jessica Douglas. Defense counsel shall not disclose the name of that witness to others, including the defendant. Ordered by District Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (KMG)

titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER - The defendant's motion for leave to appeal in forma pauperis, Filing No. 95, is granted as to Abdirahman Farah Mohamed (2). Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (AOA)
